column4: when I try to get modprobe to force the load of 'nvidia' I get FATAL: error running install command for nvidia
that's what I figured but I can't figure out why
well for starters I dont like percompiled packages, I want to know how the damn thing ticks.  and second I NEVER had this much trouble with deb.
I understand it's not open source that's not what i'm trying to say
I just want to be able to install a driver from the vender of my hardware.  I dont want to rely on the middle man.  no offense to those who maintain ubuntu.
and you can install one from nvidia or ati
well it would have to be one suited for your system
luckily the middleman was there for me so i did not need to ask synaptics for a touchpad driver or ibm for a hard drive driver
want the version of the nvidia driver you grabbed from the site
had you already installed the ubuntu provided nvidia driver?
well luckily these things are programmed in such a way to provide helpful troubleshooting data
best to build an ubuntu style deb then install it through apt
you may just as well load the config you are using, then tweak from there
